reporter_caption.center: LOW v. POWERLINE SERVICE, INC., 539 So.2d 507 (Fla.App. 4 Dist. 1989)

caption.center: YORAM LOW, APPELLANT, v. POWERLINE SERVICE, INC., A FLORIDA CORPORATION,
LARRY A. SIEGAL, KENNETH ZIMMERMAN, DAVID MANSOOR, SHALOM YEHIEL AND DORIS

court.center: District Court of Appeal of Florida, Fourth District.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Circuit Court for Broward County; Barbara S. Bridge, Judge.
opinion.attorneys:
Richard A. Sherman and Rosemary B. Wilder of Law Offices of Richard A. Sherman, P.A., Fort Lauderdale, for appellant.
Maurice M. Garcia of Abrams, Anton, Robbins, Resnick Schneider, P.A., Hollywood, for appellees-David Mansoor, Shalom Yehiel and Doris Yehiel.
opinion.opinion_text:
Holding that the mistake which occasioned denial of appellant's application forPage 508 relief was one of fact rather than law, we reverse and remand with instructions to grant the motion filed pursuant to rule 1.540(b)(1), Florida Rules of Civil Procedure.
HERSEY, C.J., STONE, J., and FRANK, RICHARD H., Associate Judge, concur.
